attributes.action: Create an Autumn Bank Holiday in November
attributes.background: The gap between the Late Summer Bank Holiday and Christmas Day is almost four months. An Autumn Bank Holiday would provide a welcome break between the two. Perhaps it could be based around Armistice Day, November 11.

attributes.action: Introduce banking skills to the secondary curriculum.
attributes.background: I believe that it is important that the use of banking services be a mandatory part of the secondary school curriculum as it would appear, from anecdotal reports and observation that many teenagers simply do not understand how to use basic banking services.

attributes.action: Stop cataract eye operations being rationed for the elderly ..
attributes.background: it is a fact that hospitals are restricting people from having cataract operations, to save money,  yet they only cost £800-00 and take about 30 mins. A lot of them would pay the £800-00  to help with the cost ,but cant afford around £3000-00.

attributes.action: Establish a National Burkini Day.
attributes.background: Swimming at beaches, in public or private pools is everyone's right.  Those who chose to do so in a Burkini should be encouraged to participate in such recreation.  Establishment of National Burkini Day would be in the best traditions of our great country.  Please support this petition.

attributes.action: Create a standard VED for all vehicles (with a fixed motor/engine) in the UK.
attributes.background: With vehicle excise duty (VED) rising year after year due to emissions, this is unfair and discriminating to large vehicle owners and being detrimental to the haulage industry, especially when hybrid and electric vehicle are exempt from VED. While the road quality in the UK is in decline.
attributes.additional_details: When VED was first introduced 1920 it was original create to help maintain the road structure of the UK up to 1937, due to weight of the vehicle using it. After 1937 it was change to a general tax, then was changed to emissions from 2001. The problem with this is some hybrid/electric vehicle weigh more than fuel vehicles, due to their components (batteries). Creating a greater stress on the road surface then a fuel vehicle. My proposal is to charge £1 for every 10kg the vehicle weighs.

attributes.action: Charge patients for not attending NHS appointments.
attributes.background: Hundreds of patients miss appointments at local GP's and Hospitals without valid reasons, who then go on to take beds in A&E when they could have been treated at their Doctors or pharmacies. For missing these appointments, without valid reasons, i believe people should pay a fine.
attributes.additional_details: People who fail to turn up or miss appointments at hospitals and local GP's, without valid reasons, should be fined or sent a bill. It is increasingly difficult to get appointments at GP's and the waiting list in Hospitals gets ever longer. By fining these people who waste these appointment not only would you raise revenue which can be invested in the NHS but would make people think twice before avoiding appointments and potentially keeping people out of A&E.

attributes.action: Save Southport A&E hospital
attributes.background:
Southport A&E hospital is on a list for closing. Think about it..... if you or your family needed emergency care where and how long would it take to get there never mind about being in the nhs queue to receive treatment. 
Please help everyone you know. Let's save southport A&E!!!!!!!

attributes.action: Develop a train service from Sheerness to Leysdown
attributes.background: The isle of Sheppey has recently seen a huge development in Neatscourt retail park near Queenborough, but the infrastructure has not been developed to allow residents from perhaps Leysdown to access it. If there was a train with multiple stops across the island, people would access its shops easier.

attributes.action: Government to introduce clause to declassify first class on trains at peak times
attributes.background: During peak / commuter hours, many trains are running at capacity except for the first class areas, which are often empty. This is forcing people to stand when they could be sitting in comfort and therefore having a more enjoyable commute to work.
attributes.additional_details: As the government is responsible for issuing the franchises to companies to run trains on the railways, I am calling for a clause to be added at the time of renewals for first class to be de classified during peak hours or on commuter trains. Unlike the intercity trains, there are no real benefits from having first class (i.e no refreshment service) and the seats are often no different. These seats could be used by more people and offer value for money when prices are  increasing annually.

attributes.action: To stop the government removing the subsidy for blood test strips.
attributes.background: I would like to ask the government not to remove the subsidy for blood test strips. Diabetics need very frequent blood testing 5+ times a day. The cost of strips is £70.00 the outcome of stopping this is reduced blood glucose testing and more hospital admissions from hyper or hypo glycemic Diabetes.

attributes.action: Impose Levy for Football clubs in the Premier/Football League for Play Areas
attributes.background:
Recent discussion about Local Authorities trying to maintain Play Areas and their possibly being forced to cut funding.
The huge sums of money available to these professional football clubs should ensure that our young people are given good places to play and keep fit.
attributes.additional_details: Recent reports in the media which imply Local Authorities may have to cut back on Play facilities.

attributes.action: Stop Government funding the Football Association - divert funds to other sports
attributes.background: The Government provides £30m+ of our tax payers money to the FA. The UK has the wealthiest football league in the world, so this funding needs to stop. Wealthy football clubs should invest in their own sport 100%; they have the means. Many other sports could benefit from re-direction of these funds.
attributes.additional_details: https://fullfact.org/news/does-football-association-get-30-million-year-public-money/

attributes.action: Change the law on pricing of haircuts/colour. Shouldn't matter what sex you are.
attributes.background: Females have been fighting for equal opportunity for decades. I called a hairdresser today to book an appointment for my partner. I asked for a price and got asked if my partner was male or female, I asked why that was important and I was told because for a female it is more expensive.
attributes.additional_details: Females have been fighting for equal opportunities for centuries. Charging females more for a haircut is no different to females getting paid less for doing the same job as a male. There should be gender neutral pricing laws. The pricing for haircuts/colour should be based on the length of the hair, not the sex of the person having their hair done. I called Kula Kuts in Kent and Toni & guy and both these salons informed me that a female having the same haircut or colour as a male would pay more.

attributes.action: Stop the Port of Dover using the A20 coast bound lane as a lorry park
attributes.background: For over ten years the port of dover has been stacking lorries on the A20 heading to the port. causing problems to local residents the works are now finished in the port and the main road to it now is the time to stop the practice of stacking lorries in front of our homes.
attributes.additional_details: A new road improvement costing millions has just been completed  with two lanes now in use. Port of Dover Police are stopping lorries on the outskirts of dover for the reason of not blocking the port which also has had a major road improvement with ten lanes to hold the lorries

attributes.action: The formation of a Sikh regiment in the British army.
attributes.background: Over 250,000 sikhs fought in the world wars under the British Empire, with many men being awarded the Victoria cross for their bravery. The British army quite rightly recognises Nepalese (Gurkhas) soliders and it is only right the sacrifice of the sikhs is honoured by forming a Sikh regiment.

attributes.action: UK Armed Police to be paid slightly more than normal police officers. Danger Pay
attributes.background:
UK Armed Police are ranked and paid like normal police officers however, im sure we can all agree the two jobs are very different.

Granted they volunteer for the role however, carrying firearms and being responsible for being the first in to terrorist threats to protect the public is different.
attributes.additional_details:
They should be paid slightly more.

Im not saying pop star wage, or even a considerable amount. Im talking a couple hundred pounds extra a month as lets say, danger pay and risk over reward pay. Give them that extra satisfaction that its worth the risk. Not everyone could do their job, it requires a different human being, so pay them that difference.

attributes.action: Stop taxing overtime, to allow us an opportunity to better ourselves.
attributes.background: No one wants to be at work let alone staying on and working additional hours let's be fair! I appreciate the taxing system and fully respect paying into it from our basic wage , when I choose to work overtime I believe it should be mine not the tax man's as my bit paid from my basic is sufficient.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal act to present wrong information to influence a public vote.
attributes.background: With the recent public vote in the UK it is clear that the argument was heavily influenced by individuals knowingly communicating wrong information.  The act of knowingly presenting unverified facts for influence should be  punished.  The message is that our democracy will not accept such behaviour.
attributes.additional_details: There has in the past year been an upsurge in politicians and individuals presenting fake facts to influence votes of national importance.  These "fake facts" and "fake news" have been seen as an acceptable tactic by the perpetrators. Our country needs to get this under control and send a signal because its continuation will undermine the democratic process.  Without sanctions these types of lies will undermine our society. The action needs to cover both traditional and social media.

attributes.action: Declare the Tube an essential service and force unions into compulsory mediation
attributes.background: Tube strikes have been paralyzing London for years for all kinds of reasons. The battle between the unions and TfL management leave the public in the lurch, suffering through queues and bringing roads to a standstill. They do great damage to economy, emergency services and environment.
attributes.additional_details: Compulsory mediation would force both parties to the negotiating table and to achieve a fair outcome through mediation by an independent third party. Strikes are avoided and the public is not harmed by abstract, arcane industrial disputes.

attributes.action: Make  sanitary products free for secondary school girls in United Kingdom
attributes.background: The cost of sanity products has gone up and this has put a strain on the already lean purse of most household . Think the sensible thing is to cushion the effect of government cuts social benefits and the rise of income tax

attributes.action: Get Patients The Right to Appeal Removal From G.P Surgery
attributes.background:
As it stands G.Ps can have a patient removed from their list simply by requesting this.
They can cite various reasons, aggressive behaviour , breakdown of Doctor Patient relationship.

The Patient has absolutely no right to appeal or even refute allegations made against them.
attributes.additional_details:
If any individual is accused of anything they should have the right to defend themselves.

In less than one year I have been removed twice & both times the reasons given were downright blatant lies.

attributes.action: Legal Immigrants on different visas category  must get ILR
attributes.background: Those immigrants who lived in Great Britain legally for 10 years should get indefinite leave to remain without any question as long as they do not have criminal convictions
attributes.additional_details:
Tier 1 visa category
Tier 2 visa category

attributes.action: Stop local councils cutting low paid jobs without first cutting top salaries.
attributes.background: Recently, Newcastle City Council approved an £8500 pay rise for its chief executive despite assurances to the contrary. Many local council chief executives earn more than the Prime Minister and yet jobs lower down the pay scale are cut to save money.
attributes.additional_details: Dan O'Donaghue's article for the chronicle drew this issue to my attention. 30/1/17

attributes.action: Ban Donald Trump from entering UK until he lifts his muslim country travel ban
attributes.background: US President Donald Trump has imposed a ban on people from seven Muslim countries entering the US. This is in contravention of the Geneva convention and is a racist and immoral act. Let him know that the people of the UK do not want him to enter our country until he lifts this ban.

attributes.action: Chemists should provide receipts of prices for all items prescribed by doctors.
attributes.background: and also give information on whether the items can be purchased over the counter. this could save both the customer and the NHS a significant   amount of money and would also show how fortunate we are to have our NHS and only be paying £8.40 per item for such high priced medication.
attributes.additional_details: I believe if people knew how much they cost the NHS each month with un needed repeat prescriptions and half finished courses of medicines, as well as knowing if the drugs available to buy cheaper  over the counter it would greatly change the attitude a lot of people have with regards to our NHS and how they can make a great financial  difference to it, freeing up  money to hire more staff, pay the staff they have a decent wage  and fund further research efforts.

attributes.action: Make the day we leave the EU a national holiday within the United Kingdom!
attributes.background: I believe the day the announcement is made stating that The United Kingdom has full left the EU we should have that date as a United Kingdom Bank Holiday and should be a day of reflection of how strong we are as a small country! 'National Brexit Day'!

attributes.action: Legalisation of Medical and Medicinal cannabis, in the United Kindom.
attributes.background: Report by Adam Smith Institute says UK’s drug strategy ‘has failed in its core aims’ and urges government to legalise cannabis
attributes.additional_details:
Cannabis should be legalised in the UK, according to a report that has the backing of several cross-party MPs including the former deputy prime minister Nick Clegg.

Current cannabis policy in Britain is a “messy patchwork” of legislation intermittently enforced by regional police and an embarrassment, says the report by the free-market thinktank the Adam Smith Institute.

attributes.action: Publish a statement reminding Donald Trump @POTUS of the UN Refugee Convention.
attributes.background: The UN Refugee Convention- Note on Non-refoulement (1977) Clearly states that "The most essential component of refugee status & of asylum is protection against return to a country where a person has reason to fear persecution. This protection has found expression in the principle of non-refoulement"
attributes.additional_details: We ask our elected politicians to send a message to the US President, that any action risking a national of a country listed in his extreme vetting exec order to be returned to the country from which they sought asylum, is a  contravention of the Convention above & more so any action will be met with sanctions, inc. the requirement for any US citizen to fully disclose financial information for the last 5 years if wishing to visit the UK, until such time the said US executive order is rescinded.

attributes.action: Issue a formal condemnation of President Trump
attributes.background: Within his first week, Donald Trump has turned the back of the world's richest country on these fleeing unimaginable horrors; has outright lied to the media of the world; and in an astonishing declaration, happily condoned torture. The UK Government should immediately condemn his presidency.
attributes.additional_details: The UK is a free nation, and should stand up for what is right. Our government is failing us by refusing to object to Donald Trump's abhorrent actions. We must not let division, injustice, and prejudice go unopposed. I believe that we must challenge these actions for the safety and dignity of our country.

attributes.action: Ban all Americans from entering the UK for 90 days too in solidarity with Iran
attributes.background: The United States of America has banned the citizens of Iran, along with those of Iraq, Libya, Syria, Somalia, Sudan, Yemen from entering the country for 90 days. To make a stand against such racial profiling, let's ban them too in solidarity with our brothers in those countries.

attributes.action: Contraceptive pill boxes to warn of major factors making the pill less effective
attributes.background: We would like legislation requiring manufacturers of contraceptive pills to clearly and prominently display a warning on the packaging showing the major factors in the pill being less effective. We would like a warning similar to that of a cigarette packet
attributes.additional_details: The side effects and health risk associated with all medication are contained on a large leaflet within the box. We would like to see the main factors causing the contraceptive pill to be less effective or ineffective printed in bold letters on the outside of the box. Many become pregnant each year believing that this will not happen as they have chosen to use the pill only to find that something else such as a bout of illness has stopped the pill working.

attributes.action: Reconstruct The Crystal Palace
attributes.background: The Crystal Palace was an impressive architectural feat with a design that was arguably ahead of its time.  This impressive piece of Victorian heritage was cruelly destroyed by fire in 1936, depriving too many from ever having seen it in all it's glory.  Please re-build this long lost treasure.
attributes.additional_details:
The Crystal Palace was first constructed in 1851 in Hyde Park for the Great Exhibition, which showcased new technology from the Industrial Revolution. It was moved to the Sydenham/Penge area in 1854 and opened by Queen Victoria.  

As an attraction the Crystal Palace showcased a wide variety of festivals and events.  Reconstructing the Palace would be a fantastic opportunity to reinvigorate the area as a cultural hub and return a part of our history that should never have been lost.

attributes.action: Seek Closer Relations With Russia
attributes.background: Russia is a powerful nation, one that is under siege. We've all heard the countless things that Russia has done to show off it's armed forces, but can we blame them? The media heavily shows Russia as the bad guys but that's simply not true. The west are the ones at fault.
attributes.additional_details: Time and time again we provoke Russia and when we get a response our media instantly turns on it's propaganda machines and makes us look innocent. What good would it be to continue trade sanctions and threatening them with military action (Not directly - but through military drills). If we wish to have 'everlasting peace in our time' - then the solution is not to provoke a country into a state where it wishes to defend itself. Instead of such provocations we should seek diplomacy of co-operation

attributes.action: Every UK pet owner/breeder/pet to be registered or £1000 fine given.
attributes.background: Reduce the number of reported/unreported animal abuse cases via strict registration laws. Owners would need to take their pet to a registration office within a week of getting the animal. Simple DNA sample to be taken from animal. Incentives for people who suspect an animal/owner is not registered.

attributes.action: Allow all Mains Post Offices in the UK to be able to issue passport forms.
attributes.background: Many main Post Offices are being asked for Passport forms on a daily basis. We undertake every other aspect of travel : insurance, currency, travel money cards and credit cards. Why do we have to send customers to competitors when we could issue and check and send passports?
attributes.additional_details: We want a level playing field for all main Post Offices who would all offer this essential service.

attributes.action: I call for all census data to be published 80 years after the date of the census
attributes.background: The 1921 census to be published in 2021 will be the last for 30 years. The 1931 census was destroyed by fire and there wasn't a 1941 census due to World War 2. We should come into line with the American Federal Census whose 1950 census will be published in 2020.
attributes.additional_details: The 1951 census should be published in 2031 to keep the 10 continuity. The census period would then be every 80 years before publication. The average age of people living is between 70 and 80 years. So you wouldn't contravene privacy laws.

attributes.action: Call a general election in two years when the terms for Brexit are known.
attributes.background:
Whilst Parliament will be given an opportunity to comment on terms of Brexit, the UK public will not be able to vote on the biggest political decision in decades.

There is no democracy in this as the terms of Brexit were not clear when the referendum vote took place.

attributes.action: Allow people to make voluntary contributions to the NHS
attributes.background:
By signing this petition you are asking MPs to debate the feasibility of allowing the public to make voluntary financial contributions to the NHS.
Voluntary contributions could help ease the strain on the health service and the people who work in it at a time when they face unprecedented pressure.
attributes.additional_details:
Allowing members of the public to make voluntary contributions to the NHS would provide people with the means to aid and potentially save an institution that has at some point in their lives helped them. 
By signing this petition you send a message of solidarity to the workers of the NHS, that you acknowledge that the difficulties the health service currently faces are not the result of their work ethos or competence but of the funding constraints that are placed upon them.

attributes.action: Lift the ban on hare coursing
attributes.background: We should lift the ban on hare coursing as it is a great tradition and if we do defend and fight for them such as fox hunting then there will be none of this country's traditions left !!
attributes.additional_details: Once the dog gets hold of the hare it is dead unlike shooting wear you could injure the hare or unsuccessfully kill it straight away

attributes.action: To stop the £1,000 immigration skills charge for workers outside the EU
attributes.background:
The Immigration Minister Robert Goodwill has suggested.
A £1,000 immigration "skills charge" is being brought in this April for firms recruiting workers from outside the EU. This means that when we leave the EU, the 3 million EU citizens, who live in this country may have to pay this too.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-38581873

attributes.action: Implement psychological well-being into the National Curriculum
attributes.background: A childs' development is fundamental for their continued success and well-being in later adult life. Schools should have a statutory responsibility to integrate psychological well-being education and support through integrating emotional coping and resilience strategies into the National Curriculum.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 4 people will experience a Mental Health issue in their lifetime. With Mental health being one of the main causes of the overall disease burden worldwide, and depression being the second largest cause of disability.

Educational establishments provide opportunity for students to develop academic, vocational, interpersonal and employability skills, yet fundamental psychological skills (i.e. coping, stress management) are very rarely discussed, let alone taught, understood or integrated.

attributes.action: Enforce deadlines upon car insurance companies for the completion of claims
attributes.background: A person involved in an accident & not at fault, can wait months if the other side ignore their insurance company and don't respond, due to their being no deadline on a response from the other party. Insurance should have 28 days to investigate blame & escalate to a dispute process if no agreement

attributes.action: Ban fee paying 'private' schools so admission to all schools is based on merit.
attributes.background: Eton was founded in 1440, over 557 years ago. It is deplorable that we allow these schools to still operate in a society where they are totally out of place. When it comes to education, meritocracy is the most sensible answer. Keep Eton, the facility's, the teachers erase the price tag.
attributes.additional_details: Independent schools in the UK cost on average £13,000 a year per child, or 32.5% of the average two income household. This means that for the average citizen these schools are unfeasible. No wonder 27,000 children attending private schools are not UK citizens. This outrageously outdated system allows the elite to become richer, by granting them better educations. Oxford and Cambridge admit more Etonians each year than applicants from the whole country who qualify for free school meals, showing how these upper class elites can buy their way into life.

attributes.action: Delay plans for harsh voter ID trials until it passes a public consultation
attributes.background: In wake of the recent tower hamlets scandal, the government is trialling plans for photo voter ID laws, which would undermine democracy and disenfranchise millions of voters
attributes.additional_details: This sets a very dangerous precedent, with the possibility that many people who do not own or are unable to get a passport or driving license are not able to exercise their democratic rights, voter registration laws have already been tightened and this signals a worrying first step toward an american style system wherein voter ID laws are passed simply to prevent certain demographics from voting, these plans need at least a public consultation or some sort of free photo ID to be provided

attributes.action: Drink in customers use of takeaway cups to be banned due to high waste volume
attributes.background: I work for one of the large chain high street coffee shops and I find it  astounding how much waste is created in these establishments alone, the worst needless waste I have seen is customers requesting takeaway cups to sit in. This needs to stop or legislation brought in to discourage this.
attributes.additional_details:
Over 3 Billion disposable coffee cups are used every year in the UK with only 1% being recycled. It is becoming an issue which can not be ignored. I understand that asking people to not use takeaway cups and bring their own is unrealistic but stopping the use of takeaway cups for sit in customers would be a fantastic start towards ending the practice and the needless waste created.

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/mar/16/takeaway-coffee-cups-recycle-environment-waste

attributes.action: Pubs closed from 27th to 30th Dec for service staff to have a Christmas break
attributes.background: Worked in hospitality all my life, never had time to be with family over Xmas, why should we not have a few days off.

attributes.action: invest HS2 funding into social care.
attributes.background: Social care in England is grossly underfunded, to the point of collapse, HS2 is a vanity development which should be shelved until austerity measures have passed or be completely privately funded.

attributes.action: The UK should follow Sweden, cut VAT for fixing goods rather than throwing away.
attributes.background: To combat its ‘throwaway consumer culture’, Sweden has announced tax breaks on repairs to clothes, bicycles, fridges and washing machines. Repairs are more labour-intense than production, which is largely automised, repairs actually contribute to an expanding labour market decreasing unemployment.
attributes.additional_details:
Jobs would be in the U.K. not abroad, they would be where you live & benefit the local economy.  Whereas large-scale manufacturing is very centralised. This will expand the number of companies giving these kinds of services so It’ll be easier for consumers to have things repaired.

It will be easier for people to buy high-quality products because they know it’s affordable to have them fixed if something breaks, giving an  incentive not to buy as cheap as possible and then scrap something.

attributes.action: Allow railway season ticket holders to vote on operator's franchise renewal.
attributes.background: Commuters usually have no choice about using the train. They cannot strike or otherwise inconvenience the operator in order to force improvements. They have no influence and are therefore totally ignored by the operators. Only if we can directly affect the operators will they take any notice of us.
attributes.additional_details:
If enough season ticket holders vote against renewal then the existing franchise holder is banned from being considered at any price.  
The vote would be open only to those holding monthly or longer season tickets for at least 3 months of the year. 
A majority of at least 60% (to be agreed) would be needed to remove the existing operator from consideration.

attributes.action: Limit the public use of drones
attributes.background: We believe that the public use of drones is a very real threat to the public and to the community around you. For example there is very easy access to drones and could be used in the wrong way. For example planes have had near misses which could have caused potential threats to the passengers.
attributes.additional_details: I would like greater expansion and enforcement of drone no-fly areas better as serious threats can be caused.There have been cases where drones have been flown into prisons and where drones have been flown over major cities without authorisation which could be potentially life threatening for the public in light of the recent terror attacks in France and Paris. Terrorists could use this equipment. Islamic state already uses drones for surveillance missions and propaganda purposes.
